content.description: Sit start the steep face just to the left of Rigid Proctoscope. Right hand on an undercling pinch and left on a good side pull at head height when sitting. Find the feet and fire straight up tp a good edge. Hold this move and you This was done intentionally as an eliminate, but skipping the sloper probably does not make it much harder.
Climb the right side of the slab. There is a harder route to its left.
content.location: Easy decent on the uphill side, or down climb slab.

content.description: You can choose your start:   Either the obvious Jug or a somewhat hidden 4 finger pocket under the roof. I have done both and they feel about the same grade (the start from the pocket is more fun IMO.   .... After choosing your start slap up the arete until you feel it's time to throw a heel and go onto the slab. A very fun interesting climb that shouldn't be missed if you're bouldering here.
Sit Start low on a fin, find good feet and move up.  find a way to move into the corner using somewhat hidden verticle crimps...
content.location: Looking at the Soggy Bottom Boulder, walk to the right and its hard to miss.    This route climbs a very cool Basalt Dike and climbs unlike any of the other problems here. Worth your time.

content.description: Sit start just to the left of Hydro Jo. Left hand on the large, sloping awkward hold and right hand on the giant undercling/sidepull that is directlyu below the start holds to HJ. Move up this epic compression problem using a lot of the obvious holds for Hydro Jo for the right hand and the ovous rail for the left. Sqeeze, and exit directly on small crimps and slopers.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter to keep you off the rock that is right there.
content.location: Imediately left of Hydro Jo on the overhanging face.

content.description: A big boulder with some fun routes. Normally pretty wet around its bottom. It could use some cleaning if someone wanted to put in the time.
